text: hey everyone so it occurred to me the
other day that I've been sharing recipes
with you for years now but I've never
taken the time to properly introduce
myself to you and I get a lot of
questions from people about you know my
background where I learned to cook where
I learned to speak English and things
like that so I thought I take today to
tell you guys a little bit about my
story so my name is pie as many of you
know my full name is Pyle in but I just
go by pie because it's easier for people
to remember and my last name if you've
ever been curious is pronounced don't it
none so I was born and raised in a small
city in the south of Thailand called hat
yay and when I was growing out we had a
live-in nanny who was also the family
cook and it was her who taught me all
the basics of Thai cooking so it was
always in the kitchen helping out with
dinner and I've always loved to cook
when I was about 12 my parents sent me
to New Zealand because they wanted me to
learn English so I went to Wellington
and I stayed with a lovely homestay
family and in New Zealand was where my
passion for cooking just exploded
because suddenly I was exposed to a
world of new and exotic foods I'd never
seen before like you know muffins and
mashed potatoes and in New Zealand they
had these lamingtons which were so cute
and it just dawned on me there was so
much more that I didn't know and
suddenly I was just so excited to try
and learn and eat all these other things
and after about a year in New Zealand I
came back to Thailand my family had
moved to Bangkok by this time so I ended
up in Bangkok by default and I went to
an international school in Bangkok which
was taught mostly by Canadians and
Americans so my English sort of went
from a New Zealand accent to the accent
that I have now and I continued to cook
as a hobby but then something happened
during high school that just really
changed my life
cable TV became available in Thailand
and suddenly we were able to watch shows
from overseas so I discovered
shows and I was just absolutely glued to
the TV watching the likes of Jamie
Oliver and Nigella Lawson and I remember
thinking that's what I want to be when I
grew up I want to have a cooking show
they look like they have so much fun I
love to cook but at the same time I
realized that that that's not a very
realistic career goal so I Padma you
know what it would be nice but let's be
realistic here so after high school I
decided to leave Thailand to explore the
world and I ended up here in Vancouver
Canada I went to the University of
British Columbia and I studied
nutritional sciences which was the
closest thing to food that they had
available for me so when I graduated
University a very strange series of
events landed me a job as a cook at the
most prestigious catering company in
town so that job basically launched me
into a career in the restaurant industry
I ended up later moving down to San
Francisco to go to culinary school which
is the best time of my life and
eventually I ended up working as a chef
with a Thai restaurant group and helped
them open a new restaurant in the Bay
Area so after a few years in the States
I moved back to Vancouver Canada because
I got my permanent residency here and
I've been here ever since
so when in hot Thai Kitchen start in all
of this well back when I was a culinary
school student in San Francisco my dream
of having my own cooking show was still
serve in the back of my mind and my
brother one day introduced me to the
concept of YouTube shows not just
YouTube cat videos actual shows on
YouTube so I thought hey I can do that I
can have my own cooking show and just
like that outside kitchen was born in
the beginning hot Thai Kitchen was a
hobby I loved doing it but I did it
whenever I had time once in a blue moon
and when you work in the restaurant
industry you didn't have a lot of time
and when I came back to Canada I had
some time to sort of reevaluate what I
wanted to do with my life and I decided
to give hot Thai kitchen a serious go so
I started putting more time into it
investing in better equipment I got my
cameraman Adam involved I took over his
kitchen which we're in right now and
that basically brings us to where we are
today and hatta kitchen has led me to
other opportunities outside of youtube
as many of you know my cookbook came out
earlier this year and that was another
dream come true and I really put my
heart and soul and everything into that
book I'm now also a host of a Canadian
TV cooking show called one world kitchen
so it's kind of funny how I ended up on
TV after all and my latest startup which
I'm super excited about is pies kitchen
my second show on YouTube on the same
channel where I explore all the
different delicious cuisines around the
world so I hope you feel like you know
me a little bit better if you have more
questions I plan on doing and ask me
anything video in the near future so
please send me your questions however
instead of putting them in the comment
section below where I might miss them
because they're usually a lot of
comments send them through the contact
form on my website and I'll definitely
see it so put the link right up here and
also in the description box below thank
you so much for watching and for always
supporting my hot Thai kitchen adventure
and I'll see you next time
you
[Music]
